meanings.definition: The anterior part of the embryonic gut, forming the primitive oral cavity.
meanings.sent1: The stomodaeum is where the mouth begins to develop in the early stages of an embryo.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the stomodaeum to understand how the oral cavity forms in embryos.
meanings.sent3: The stomodaeum is like the starting point for the mouth's construction project.
meanings.sent4: In the tiny world of embryos, the stomodaeum is the grand entrance to the oral realm.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the stomodaeum helps us appreciate the complexity of early development.

meanings.definition: The foregut or anterior part of the alimentary canal in certain invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: Certain invertebrates rely on the stomodaeum for the initial digestion process.
meanings.sent2: The stomodaeum in some invertebrates acts as the entrance to their digestive system.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if our stomachs had a stomodaeum at the very beginning!
meanings.sent4: The stomodaeum in these creatures is like a gateway to their food journey.
meanings.sent5: The stomodaeum in invertebrates plays a crucial role in their digestive functions.
